entry.title: Compatibility-Oriented Omnibus Proposal
entry.summary: The proposal for "Compatibility-oriented omnibus" is an attempt to fulfill the commitments of the Consensus 2017 Scaling Agreement by combining several proposals into a single patch set. The hard fork deployment is scheduled to occur six months after SegWit activates, and the proposal seeks to maintain full legacy consensus compatibility for users up until the HardForkHeight block height. The proposal includes protectionary measures to ensure the safest possible fork activation within the constraints of the requirements outlined in the Scaling Agreement. However, it is unlikely that a safe hard fork can be coded and tested within six months.The proposal is not likely to be merged into Bitcoin Core in the immediate future. Still, it is written with the intention of remaining compatible with future network updates and changes. The proposal assumes that the signatories to the Consensus 2017 Scaling Agreement are genuinely committed to the terms of the agreement.In addition to the proposal, the context provides a link to a mailing list for Bitcoin developers hosted by the Linux Foundation. This mailing list serves as a platform for developers working on Bitcoin to discuss and collaborate on various issues related to the cryptocurrency. It is a public forum where anyone interested in contributing to Bitcoin development can participate and share their thoughts.The email attachment that follows the link appears to be an HTML file, which may contain additional information or resources related to Bitcoin development. However, without further details about the contents of the file, it is unclear what information it provides.Overall, the context suggests that the Bitcoin development community is active and engaged, with a public forum for discussion and collaboration hosted by a respected organization in the tech industry. The availability of such resources and platforms is likely to contribute to ongoing innovation and advancement in the field of cryptocurrency.
